definition: to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
danger/dangerous/rugged

sentences.english: That was a close call.We nearly hit that car.
sentences.chinese: 真是好險啊，我們差點撞上那輛汽車。

sentences.english: The mountain was high and steep, and the snow knee-deep. It was really dangerous to climb.
sentences.chinese: 山又高又陡，而且雪深沒膝，爬上去好險呀。

sentences.english: It was extremely dangerous. We were nearly hit by the stone.
sentences.chinese: 剛纔好險，石頭差點砸中我們。

sentences.english: My car almost hit the guy, what a close call.
sentences.chinese: 我的車幾乎撞到那個人了，真是好險呀。

sentences.english: That was a close shave, nearly leaving your passport behind.
sentences.chinese: 差點把你的護照落下，真是好險。

sentences.english: I may have just passed the exam, but it's touch and go.
sentences.chinese: 我可能剛好通過考試，不過好險。

definition: back of the head
fortunately/luckily
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to stop breathing/to breathe one's last/to die/to cut the gas supply
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to have good luck/lucky/in luck
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
clumsy/all thumbs
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
dirty
mistake/to make a mistake/to blunder/mistaken
